avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and southerly wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form in high Alpine regions. Dry and moist avalanches can be released in near-surface layers and reach medium size, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.
In particular low altitudes: As a consequence of the rain moist and wet snow slides are possible as the day progresses, even medium-sized ones. In particular on very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow above the tree line: As the snowfall level drops the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Saturday the weather has been exceptionally warm. These spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.
The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night. The rain will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack below the tree line.
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 2000 m.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1200 m snow will fall over a wide area. Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and southerly wind, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs will form in high Alpine regions. Dry and moist avalanches can be released in near-surface layers and reach medium size, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.
In particular low altitudes: As a consequence of the rain moist and wet snow slides are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small. In particular on very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow at high altitude: As the snowfall level drops the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent in the afternoon.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been very mild. These spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in some cases in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night. The rain will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack below the tree line. 10 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 2000 m.
At intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1300 m snow will fall in some regions. In some localities increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the snowfall.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the rain wet and gliding avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even medium-sized ones. In particular on very steep grassy slopes the wet avalanches can slide on the ground.
Slight increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as the snowfall level drops. The new snow and wind slabs can be released very easily at high altitude, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Up to high altitudes rain will fall. Moist and wet avalanches and gliding avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night.
The rain will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack in all altitude zones. 5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 2100 m.
At intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1600 m snow will fall in some regions. In some localities increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the snowfall.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the rain moist and wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even medium-sized ones. In particular in extremely steep terrain moist avalanches can slide on the ground.
Individual gliding avalanches can also be released in the night or in the morning. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Up to high altitudes rain will fall. Moist loose snow slides and gliding avalanches are still possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night.
The rain will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack in all altitude zones.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the rain wet snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even medium-sized ones, in particular on very steep slopes at low and intermediate altitudes.
Gradual increase in danger of dry and moist avalanches as the snowfall level drops. The new snow and wind slabs can be released very easily at high altitude, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes.

The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Early morning: Up to 2200 m rain will fall. Moist and wet avalanches and wet loose snow slides are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Since Friday the weather has been exceptionally warm. The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night.
The rain will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes. 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 1800 m.
At intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Above approximately 1400 m snow will fall in some regions. In some localities increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the snowfall.
